episodeTitle: The Battle in the Ryugu Palace! Zoro vs. Hordy!
episodeTitleJapanese: 竜宮城の決戦！ゾロVSホーディ
episodeTitleRomanized: Ryūgū-jō no Kessen! Zoro tai Hōdi
description: Zoro engages in an underwater battle with Hody Jones at Ryugu Palace while Hody reveals his plan to revive Arlong's dream and begins flooding the palace. Meanwhile, Robin searches the Sea Forest for ancient secrets, and Luffy becomes branded as a kidnapper by angry Fish-Men.

events.title: Zoro vs Hody Jones - Underwater Battle Begins
events.description: Zoro decides to hold off Hody Jones while the others escape from Ryugu Palace. Despite the disadvantage of fighting underwater as a human, Zoro engages Hody in combat. This marks a crucial confrontation between the Straw Hat crew and the New Fish-Man Pirates.
events.significance: This battle demonstrates Zoro's post-timeskip strength and his willingness to fight even at a significant disadvantage to protect his crewmates. It also showcases the growing threat of Hody Jones and the New Fish-Man Pirates.

events.title: Hody Jones Uses Yabusame
events.description: Hody Jones demonstrates his Fish-Man Karate technique Yabusame, where he throws water droplets (or air bubbles when underwater) with tremendous force, converting them into deadly arrows through kinetic energy. As he executes this technique, a silhouette of Arlong briefly appears over him, symbolizing his connection to Arlong's fighting style.
events.significance: This technique showcases Hody's mastery of Fish-Man Karate and his connection to Arlong's legacy. It demonstrates the power level of the New Fish-Man Pirates and the threat they pose to the Straw Hats.

quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody executes his water arrow technique against Zoro

events.title: Zoro Uses Ittoryu: Yakkodori
events.description: Zoro counters Hody's attacks with Yakkodori, a one-sword style technique where he launches a crescent moon-like projectile of compressed air at his opponent with great speed. The attack is powerful enough to critically injure one of Hody's subordinates whom he uses as a shield.
events.significance: This demonstrates Zoro's new post-timeskip techniques and his ability to fight effectively even underwater. The technique shows his growth in power during the two-year training period.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro executes his one-sword style technique

events.title: Hody Jones Uses Soshark
events.description: Hody Jones demonstrates Soshark (Rough Shark), a technique where he uses his tremendous strength and grip to crush large walls of stone. He uses this to break the walls of Ryugu Palace, allowing water to flood into the palace.
events.significance: This technique serves as a turning point in the battle, as Hody uses it to create a tactical advantage by flooding the palace, putting the Straw Hats and Neptune's forces at a severe disadvantage.

quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody crushes the palace walls to flood the structure

events.title: Hody Floods Ryugu Palace
events.description: Hody Jones declares his intention to destroy both Neptune's army and the Straw Hat Pirates, then proceeds to flood Ryugu Palace using his Soshark technique to break the walls. The flooding creates a dire situation for everyone trapped inside who cannot breathe underwater.
events.significance: This represents a critical escalation in Hody's attack on Ryugu Palace and demonstrates his ruthlessness. By flooding the palace, he creates a tactical advantage for his Fish-Man forces while endangering everyone else, including his own allies who might not be able to breathe underwater.

quotes.text: I will destroy the army and the Straw Hats!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody declares his intentions before flooding the palace

events.title: Hody Reveals Plan to Revive Arlong's Dream
events.description: Hody Jones comments on Neptune's weakness and reveals that he only joined Neptune's army to gain military strength and knowledge. He declares his true intention: to revive the dream and ambition of Arlong, his former captain and idol.
events.significance: This revelation establishes Hody's motivation and his connection to the Arlong Park arc. It shows that the conflict with Arlong was not fully resolved and that his ideology has inspired a new generation of extremist Fish-Men. This creates a thematic link to the East Blue saga.

quotes.text: I will revive the dream and ambition of Arlong!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody reveals his true motivation to Neptune and the others

events.title: Nami's Reaction to Arlong's Name
events.description: When Hody Jones declares his intention to revive Arlong's dream, Nami is visibly shocked and disturbed. This moment brings back the trauma of her past enslavement under Arlong. During Hody's speech, she manages to escape with Camie.
events.significance: This moment connects back to one of the most emotionally powerful arcs in One Piece - the Arlong Park arc. Nami's reaction shows that despite her growth and freedom, the mention of Arlong still affects her deeply, adding emotional weight to the conflict with Hody Jones.

events.title: Nami and Camie Escape from Ryugu Palace
events.description: Taking advantage of Hody's distraction during his speech about reviving Arlong's dream, Nami successfully escapes from Ryugu Palace together with Camie. This allows them to avoid being trapped when Hody floods the palace.
events.significance: Nami's escape demonstrates her quick thinking and survival instincts. Getting Camie to safety also shows her protective nature and growth as a character since her own traumatic experience under Fish-Man oppression.

events.title: Robin Arrives at the Sea Forest
events.description: Robin ventures into the Sea Forest in search of ancient secrets and historical knowledge. She arrives at the location where the Thousand Sunny is docked and where Franky is working on ship repairs. She then sets out to search for the Poneglyph.
events.significance: Robin's arrival at the Sea Forest sets up her discovery of the Joy Boy Poneglyph, which is a crucial piece of One Piece lore. This location visit represents Robin's continued pursuit of historical truth and the mysteries of the Void Century.

events.title: Robin Discovers References to the Poneglyph
events.description: As Robin explores the Sea Forest, she is on the path to discovering the Poneglyph that contains Joy Boy's apology to the people of Fish-Man Island. This Poneglyph reveals ancient history about a promise made during the Void Century.
events.significance: This event is crucial to One Piece's overarching narrative. The Joy Boy Poneglyph is one of the most important historical artifacts discovered so far, providing insight into the Void Century, the true nature of the Ancient Kingdom, and the connection between Joy Boy and the current storyline. It sets up major revelations about Fish-Man Island's role in the world's history.

events.title: Luffy Branded as Royal Kidnapper
events.description: As Luffy travels with Shirahoshi hidden inside Megalo (her pet shark), the citizens of Fish-Man Island spot them together. Seeing Princess Shirahoshi outside the palace with the human pirate Luffy, the angry mob of Fish-Men brand him as a kidnapper of their beloved princess.
events.significance: This misunderstanding creates tension between Luffy and the citizens of Fish-Man Island, adding to the chaos of the arc. It also demonstrates the protective nature of Fish-Men toward Shirahoshi and their distrust of humans, which is a central theme of the arc.

events.title: Dosun's Childhood Flashback (Anime Original)
events.description: An anime-original flashback shows Dosun as a child being kidnapped by pirates. Hody Jones and the other future officers of the New Fish-Man Pirates attempt to rescue him but are beaten down. Eventually, Arlong arrives and saves Dosun, cementing Arlong's role as a hero figure in young Hody's eyes.
events.significance: This anime-original content provides additional context for Hody's devotion to Arlong and the formation of the New Fish-Man Pirates. It shows how Arlong's actions inspired a generation of Fish-Man children and explains the origins of their extremist ideology.

events.title: Usopp Uses Midori Boshi: Rafflesia
events.description: Usopp demonstrates one of his new post-timeskip Pop Green techniques, Midori Boshi: Rafflesia, during the conflict at Ryugu Palace. This plant-based attack releases a powerful stench that can incapacitate opponents.
events.significance: This showcases Usopp's growth during the two-year timeskip and his new botanical-based fighting style developed on the Boin Archipelago. It demonstrates the Straw Hats' increased power levels as they enter the New World.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp uses his Pop Green technique

events.title: Zoro Uses Pre-Timeskip Technique Underwater
events.description: During the underwater battle, Zoro uses Santoryu: Tatsu Maki, a three-sword style technique he used before the timeskip. The anime extends the fight by showing Zoro using techniques from before his two-year training period, demonstrating that his old techniques are still effective.
events.significance: This moment shows continuity in Zoro's fighting style while also highlighting the unique challenge of fighting underwater. It demonstrates that Zoro's pre-timeskip techniques remain powerful and relevant even in the New World.

events.title: Zoro Asks for Help Freeing the Soldiers
events.description: As the palace begins to flood, Zoro instructs Usopp and Brook to help free Neptune's soldiers who are trapped in the palace. This shows Zoro's strategic thinking and his concern for innocent lives even during a dangerous battle.
events.significance: This demonstrates Zoro's growth as a character and his role as the unofficial first mate of the Straw Hat Pirates. Despite being in the middle of a dangerous fight, he thinks about the bigger picture and ensures the safety of Neptune's forces.

quotes.text: I will revive the dream and ambition of Arlong!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody executes his water arrow technique

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro counters with his one-sword technique

quotes.text: I will destroy the army and the Straw Hats!
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody's declaration before flooding the palace

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp uses his Pop Green technique

themes.description: The episode explores how Arlong's extremist ideology has been passed down to Hody Jones and the New Fish-Man Pirates, showing how hatred and prejudice can span generations.
themes.symbolism: The silhouette of Arlong appearing over Hody during battle symbolizes how the past influences the present and how ideologies can outlive their originators.

themes.description: Nami's reaction to hearing Arlong's name shows how traumatic experiences continue to affect people long after they've escaped their situations.
themes.symbolism: Nami's visible distress represents the lasting psychological impact of oppression and abuse.

themes.description: Zoro fighting underwater demonstrates the Straw Hats' growth and their willingness to fight even at a severe disadvantage to protect others.
themes.symbolism: The underwater battle represents the challenges the crew faces in the New World and their determination to overcome any obstacle.

themes.description: Robin's search for the Poneglyph in the Sea Forest represents the ongoing quest to uncover the truth about the Void Century and the world's hidden history.
themes.symbolism: The Sea Forest, a graveyard of ships, symbolizes forgotten history and lost knowledge waiting to be rediscovered.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his post-timeskip strength and strategic thinking by engaging Hody underwater despite the disadvantage, showing his growth as a fighter and as the crew's unofficial first mate.
keyActions: Decides to hold off Hody while others escape
Instructs Usopp and Brook to free the soldiers

characterSpotlights.development: Hody reveals his true motivations and demonstrates his ruthlessness by declaring war on both Neptune's army and the Straw Hats, then flooding the palace to gain tactical advantage.
keyActions: Reveals plan to revive Arlong's dream
Uses Soshark to break palace walls
Declares intention to destroy the army and Straw Hats
quotes: I will revive the dream and ambition of Arlong!
I will destroy the army and the Straw Hats!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami's shocked reaction to Arlong's name being mentioned shows the lasting impact of her traumatic past, while her successful escape with Camie demonstrates her resourcefulness and growth.
keyActions: Reacts with shock to Hody mentioning Arlong
Escapes with Camie during Hody's speech

characterSpotlights.development: Robin continues her lifelong quest to uncover historical truth by venturing into the Sea Forest in search of Poneglyphs and ancient secrets.
keyActions: Searches for ancient secrets and Poneglyphs

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime includes an original flashback showing Dosun as a child being kidnapped by pirates, with Hody and the future officers attempting to rescue him before Arlong saves them. This scene does not appear in the manga.
In the manga, Usopp hit Brook offpanel after Brook made an insensitive joke regarding Arlong. In the anime, Usopp instead told Brook to shut up in an angry tone.
Zoro's fight with Hody is extended in the anime, showing him using Santoryu: Tatsu Maki and other techniques from before the timeskip that were not shown in the manga version of this battle.

trivia.fact: This episode marks one of the rare instances where Zoro fights a major battle completely underwater, showcasing his adaptability as a swordsman even in the most disadvantageous conditions.

The silhouette of Arlong appearing over Hody Jones during the Yabusame technique is a visual callback to the Arlong Park arc, emphasizing the connection between the two antagonists and their shared ideology.
Hody's Yabusame technique can be executed both on land using water droplets and underwater using air bubbles, demonstrating the versatility of Fish-Man Karate.
This episode aired on February 19, 2012 in Japan, during the middle of the Fish-Man Island arc which ran from October 2011 to September 2012.
The opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani was used for 74 episodes (517-590), making it one of the longer-running One Piece opening themes.
